Detailed Description

template<typename VarArray1, typename VarArray2, BOOL Less = false>
struct LexLeqConstraint< VarArray1, VarArray2, Less >

constraints;lexless Description The constraint

lexless(vec0, vec1)

takes two vectors vec0 and vec1 of the same length and ensures that vec0 is lexicographically less than vec1 in any solution. constraints;lexless Notes This constraint maintains GAC. constraints;lexless References See also

help constraints lexleq

for a similar constraint with non-strict lexicographic inequality. constraints;lexleq Description The constraint

lexleq(vec0, vec1)

takes two vectors vec0 and vec1 of the same length and ensures that vec0 is lexicographically less than or equal to vec1 in any solution. constraints;lexleq Notes This constraints achieves GAC. constraints;lexleq References See also

help constraints lexless

for a similar constraint with strict lexicographic inequality.

virtual triggerCollection LexLeqConstraint< VarArray1, VarArray2, Less >::setup_internal (  )  [inline, virtual]

Gets all the triggers a constraint wants to set up.

This function shouldn't do any propagation. That is full_propagate's job.

Definition at line 314 of file constraint_lex.h.

template<typename VarArray1, typename VarArray2, BOOL Less = false>
virtual bool LexLeqConstraint< VarArray1, VarArray2, Less >::get_satisfying_assignment ( box< pair< int, DomainInt > > &  assignment  )  [inline, virtual]

Looks for a valid partial assignment to a constraint.

The return value (in the box) is pairs of <varnum, domain value>, where varnum is in the same position as returned by get_vars.
